description.narrative: The objectives of an audit is the expression of an opinion on the financial reports/statements. it is expected that the Consultant (Claritas International) will perform the audit in accordance with International Standards on Auditing. The Indian House Crow Eradication project was implemented by Wildlife Conservation Society tanzania. and Local Government Authorities. This audit is expected to cover both WCST and Local Government Authorities in 3 regions i.e Tanga Coast and dar es Salaam and sampled 5 distri cts: Temeke, Ilala, Kinondoni, Kibaha and Tanga.The audit is expected to look into poison team work as an additional monitoring of support to crow's eradication and finally overall WCST role as per midterm financial management findings. The audit covers fi nancial year january to December 2011 and 2012 including January to August 2013. The audited statements with the opinion for the audited periods as well as management letter should be submitted to the Embassy of Finland. The assignment is conducted over a period of 4 weeks commencing 2nd September - 27th September 2013The audit is to: March the financial figures of development partners disbursement vs funds received by WCST, Determine whether financial statements and activity reports submitted to developme nt partners reflect the state of the intended objectivees and approved work plans, Determine whether funds have exclusively been used to cover eligible expenses relevant to the project, Verify and assess the assets inventory list, Ascertain whether all nec essary documents books and information have been kept in respect of all transactions carried out by the partners.
